activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

2:38 PM Defendant Daniel Wilson Jr. appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Daniel Wilson Jr.  Attorney David S Olson in court for State of Wisconsin.
Calendar call scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity: Return on warrant/Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Wilson Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Daniel Wilson Jr. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address not given. Signature bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
No driving without a valid drivers license or valid insurance.
